sourceMeaningMnemonic: If there's a <radical>treasure chest</radical>, there's always a <kanji>villain</kanji> too. The villain is trying to get to the treasure chest before the hero of the story.
meaningInfo: And the villain always gets to the treasure chest first, often via nefarious means. That villain is SO important when it comes to treasure chests.
readingMnemonic: The <kanji>villain</kanji> beat you all the way to <ja><reading>きょう</reading>と</ja> to get this particular treasure chest.
readingInfo: Arrrg! If only you had been closer to <ja>きょうと</ja>! Then you might have beaten this dastardly villain.
